verses.verse: To the chaunter, in melodyes, a Psalme, & songe of Asaph. In Iewrye is God knowne, his name is greate in Israel.
At Schalem is his tabernacle, and his dwellyng in Sion.
There brake he the arowes of the bowe, the shylde, the swerde, and the battayle. Sela.
Thou art of more honour and myght then the hylles of robbers.
The proude are robbed: they haue slepte their slepe: and all the men (whose handes were myghtie) haue found nothinge.
At thy rebuke (O God of Iacob) both the charet and horse is fallen.
Thou, euen thou art to be feared: and who may stande in thy syght, when thou art angrye.
Thou dyddest cause thy iudgement to be herde from heauen, the erth trembled and was styll.
When God arose to iudgement, & to helpe all the meke vpon earth. Sela.
The fearcenesse of man shall turne to thy prayse: and the fearcenesse of other shalt thou refrayne.
Promyse vnto the Lorde youre God, & kepe it, all ye that be rounde about hym: bryng presentes vnto hym that ought to be feared.
He shall refrayne the sprete of Prynces, and is wonderfull amonge the kynges of the earth.
